Description.val:
Ground/Air Task Oriented Radar (G/ATOR AN/TPS-80) - The Ground/Air Task Oriented Radar is a multi-role, ground-based, expeditionary radar that replaces five legacy radar systems for the Marine Air Ground Task Force.
It satisfies the Marine Air Command and Control System (G/ATOR Block 1) and the Ground Counter Fire/Counter Battery (G/ATOR Block 2) capabilities. The G/ATOR replaces the AN/TPS-63 and complements the AN/TPS-59 long range radar and will provide mobile, multi-functional, three-dimensional surveillance of air breathing targets, detection of cruise missiles and Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS), and the cueing of air defense weapons. The G/ATOR contributes to the extension of Sea Shield/Sea Strike through surveillance and detection of enemy air threats not seen by Navy sensors in the littorals by participating in a cooperative engagement network of sensors and shooters; G/ATOR enables Integrated Fire Control (IFC) and provides engage/fire on remote capability. G/ATOR surveillance coverage with IFC will provide unprecedented reach, volume, and precision in the execution of Operational Maneuver From The Sea allowing Naval forces to project and sustain power deep inland. Prior year funding and quantities for the G/ATOR program can be found in BLI 4650 - Radar Systems.

Justification.val:
FY2018 Base Appropriation Request:
AN/TPS-80 G/ATOR $134.726M - FY18 funding procured three (3) Gallium Nitride (GaN) LRIP G/ATOR systems and provided funding for support associated with the procurement of systems, hardware, program management and logistics required for G/ATOR fielding related activities as the ICLS contract awarded Oct 17 supported eight (8) fielded systems in FY18.

FY2019 Base Appropriation Request  $220.416M ($101.059M Active; $119.357M Reserves)
AN/TPS-80 G/ATOR $220.416M - FY19 funding procures six (6) G/ATOR systems and provides logistic/program support associated with the procurement of systems, hardware, program management and logistics required for G/ATOR fielding related activities. The increase in funding from FY18 to FY19 primarily reflects the increase in G/ATORs from three (3) to six (6) systems ($95.690M) as part of the first year of full Rate Production, increases in logistics ($4.110M) to support fielding of four (4) additional systems for a total of twelve (12) fielded systems through FY19 and a slight increase for Communications Equipment Group (CEG) Shelters ($1.077M) necessary to support the initial Full Rate Production Lot procurement quantity of six (6) systems.

FY2020 Base Appropriation Request  $273.022M ($151.175M Active; $121.847M Reserves)
AN/TPS-80 G/ATOR $273.022M - FY20 funding will procure eight (8) G/ATOR systems and provide logistic/program support associated with the procurement of systems, hardware, program management and logistics required for G/ATOR fielding related activities. The increase in funding from FY19 to FY20 primarily reflects the increase in G/ATORs from six (6) to eight (8) systems ($59.646M) as part of the second year of full Rate Production, as well as, other minor increases to include implementing Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) ($0.849M), focusing on Radar Emplacement/Displacement improvements, and Communications Equipment Group (CEG) Shelters ($0.606M) necessary to support the second Full Rate Production Lot procurement quantity of eight (8) systems.

FiscalYear.@footnote: Date of FY15 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR LRIP contract awarded in March 2015.
Date of FY16 First Delivery is incentivized based on the G/ATOR GaN LRIP contract awarded in August 2016.
Date of FY17 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR GaN LRIP contract option execrcised March 2017.
Date of FY18 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR GaN LRIP contract option execrcised March 2018.
Date of FY19 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR FRP contract award anticipated 28 June 2019.
Date of FY20 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR FRP contract award anticipated 31 May 2020.

Name.@footnote: Systems Engineering Program Management (SEPM) is a negotiated cost within the Full Rate Production (FRP) Contract that funds the Prime Contractor's management of the G/ATOR Radar system engineering and production efforts. Funding request is based on the SEPM Cost Estimate validated at Milestone "C".

ECO funding addresses emergent corrective actions from DT1C/OA, DT1D/OA and DT1E/IOT&E testing, as well as diminishing manufacturing sources/material shortages and user community feedback to improve Human Systems Integration (HSI). ECO funding also reduces the number of material/electronic obsolesce issues and ultimately improve future Marine Forces readiness.    FY18/19 ECOs include the Precision Timing Unit, Radome and Antenna Support Electronics Covers and Pallet Communications Support Processors (PCSPs).   FY20 ECOs include PCSP and GB2 Hardware improvements with a focus on reducing Radar Emplacement/Displacement time.

Funding supports facilitization (tooling) for the Near Field Range, Line Replaceable Unit (LRU) Repair and Inspect and Repair Only As Necessary (IROAN) activities at Tobyhanna Army Depot. LRU Repair facilitization continues in FY20.

This requirement is derived from Change 4 of G/ATOR Block 2 Capabilities Development Document. The increase of $0.606M from FY19 to FY20 procures Communications Equipment Group (CEG) Shelters and their associated components to support the G/ATOR FRP Lot 2 procurement quantity of eight (8). The CEG Shelter is comprised of an S-788 Shelter on an up-armored HMMWV, providing the G/ATOR system with operator interfaces and communications processing.  The CEG Shelter is an integral component of the G/ATOR System and supports external Command and Control voice and digital communications to CAC2S, CTN, and AFATDS.
With G/ATOR being post Milestone C and in the second year of Full Rate Production, program management support completely migrated from RDT&E to PMC funding in FY19.

G/ATOR's product support strategy employs a combination of Contractor Logistics Support (CLS) and Interim Contactor Logistics Support (ICLS) until a hybrid Performance Based Logistics/Organic Maintenance is established during the Full Rate Production phase beginning in FY20 and supporting all G/ATOR's. Contractor Logistics Support (CLS) is for the LRIP systems through the testing phase. Contractor Logistics Support/Interim Contactor Logistics Support (CLS/ICLS) supports the fielding of thirteen (13) G/ATOR LRIP systems to include their maintenance and repair, and the maintenance and repair of LRIP systems undergoing test prior to fielding.  Additionally, it is capturing the necessary usage data in preparation for Performance Based Logistics, monitoring DMS issues, completing provisioning requirements, updating the Interactive Electronic Training Manual (ITEM) for new software builds and preparing for and conducting three (3) New Equipment Training (NET) events in FY 20. These additional CLS efforts will continue through the Production and Deployment phase of the G/ATOR System.
